https://prez.dev/description.@value: The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought
An alternative lexical label for a resource
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
Relates a concept to the concept scheme that it is a top level concept of

Terms that describe the ratio of temperature to pressure (T/P) during metamorphism, defining a classification scheme based on thermal gradient that is regarded as the most appropriate for building a temporal geodynamic context for metamorphic data. Some of these terms only partly correspond to metamorphic facies fields and classic-style terminology such as Barrovian and Buchan (i.e. correspondence is not one-for-one).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Ultra-high geothermal gradient or ultra-high apparent thermal gradient metamorphism, characterized by very high heat flow. That is, temperature increases much more rapidly than average with depth. Defined by apparent thermal gradients between 150 and 250°C/kbar (or 1500 and 2500°C/GPa), and encompassing most of what is traditionally referred to as Buchan-style metamorphism. Ultra-high thermal gradients encompass low-pressure amphibolite facies (incorporating andalusite stability), low-pressure granulite facies, and rare low-pressure, ultra-high temperature metamorphism. Thermal gradient is defined in terms of pressure (i.e. thermobarometric ratio) rather than depth in kilometres to avoid assumptions involving density-related conversions.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value:
Adapted from:
a) Brown, M 2006, Duality of thermal regimes is the distinctive characteristic of plate tectonics since the Neoarchean: Geology,v.34,no.11,p.961–964, doi:10.1130/G22853A.1.
b) Stüwe, K 2007, Geodynamics of the lithosphere: An introduction: Springer, Berlin, 493p.
c) Brown, M and Johnson, T 2018, Secular change in metamorphism and the onset of global plate tectonics: American Mineralogist,v.103,no.2,p.181–196, doi:10.2138/am-2018-6166.
